title: Emitdama
author: Emitdama
created_time: November 15, 2022, 06:39:31 AMLast edit: November 15, 2022, 10:03:43 AM by Emitdama
content: When I was a newbie, I could not remember that I ever checked Important Announcements sub.I am sure that was kind of newbie mistake hence decided to make this topic to spread a word about theymos' important announcement which is definitely a today's need as per the scenarios going on in crypto space.theymos opened a new topic after almost 4 years of time (hence you also might have forgot the existence of such board) and I wish everyone not to miss that topic, so that learn and act accordingly to ensure the safety of hard earned bitcoins .

comments.author: TheBeardedBaby
comments.body: Everything that goes in that section is pinned on the news feed, so you don't really need to browse the section. If it's not pinned than it's obsolete.If there's something important you will notice it into the news feed.The last post is the result of this topic

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Emitdama on November 15, 2022, 06:39:31 AMtheymos opened a new topic after almost 4 years of time (hence you also might have forgot the existence of such board) and I wish everyone not to miss this and also learn and act accordingly to ensure the safety of our hard earned bitcoin.I just made aware of the post cause I saw it via pinned post. So its possible that everyone will see it. Hoping that newbie will check it out cause what theymos wrote there is really helpful advice and a very nice realization and fact on asset holding our tokens and coins.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Thermos is right to say that the contagion will spread accross other companies. Therefore, people should be in control of their funds. This is just the worst thing, the market has gone through difficult times; bitcoin dropped to 3k, Luna crashed which affected Bitcoin price, China banned Bitcoin, Celsius disputes etc, but this situation right here is unbearable. Companies that trusted investors money on FTX are facing hard times too. This bankruptcy not only did it affect FTX, it has ruined good businesses and the effect of it like thermos said will continue to spread out to other companies. The only remedy, is taking your funds out from any online company and save them in a wallet.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: In addition to what everyone has comment about OP thread, i think we need to have a much clearer understanding of why some certain threads were pinned, this is to help everyone come across them easily whenever they are visiting a particular board and this will help not to go against the rules associated with the board, to me OP is just creating a repetition of what everyone is already aware of but nevertheless i think someone may be find it as a reminder.

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: Quote from: Doan9269 on November 15, 2022, 03:40:22 PM~snip~, to me OP is just creating a repetition of what everyone is already aware of but nevertheless i think someone may be find it as a reminder. Of course, this is a repetition of information and also a reminder. I didn't even notice that theymos embedding some pretty important up-to-date information related to recent events.There's nothing wrong with the OP about a non-breaking loop, it's a reminder to those who don't focus on the main embed. and this thread also helps us all discuss what theymos explained because in the main thread the thread can only be seen and cannot comment.Discussing the essence of the announcement, Theymos reminds us not to save our money or assets in online accounts that we cannot fully control. It is best to store it in a private wallet which of course only we have access to. Bankruptcy will occur if we keep all the money or assets in an online account and the account website disappears and goes bankrupt, then our money will also disappear.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Actually anyone who is forum user will obviously come in contact with the announcement because it's in the front of the forum dashboard, and it's pinned and locked, so immediately you click there it will take you to the board directly without uttering anything. So it's only the newbies who are some weeks old will not likely detect such pinned announcement by the theymos. Shall i appluad you by putting more effort to make it to be known to someone people who didn't seen it or been unknown to.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: A newbie who's just been here for a few days or a week will probably think that a link just below the username isn't some big deal announcement. One might think there's always a link there about anything. However, what's in the link is also something anybody must have stumbled upon in the news, whether mainstream business or finance news or crypto-related online news sites. It is even all over social media. I guess this is just the admin doing his part in spreading awareness. Also, even if a newbie doesn't click on the link, the reminder is already there, concise and on point!

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Despite the fact that the information is widely available online, on social media, and throughout the globe, it is still crucial to spread it here. Not every subforum's pinned message is viewed by everyone, but seeing this one on the forum's front page will catch the attention of members who don't care to read significant pinned messages in subgroups. I hope everyone, in particular newbies, become familiar with the crucial messages presented here and heed the warnings.
